Package com.github.sahasatvik.math

Class MathParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.sahasatvik.math.MathParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpressionParser

    public class MathParser
extends java.lang.Object
    MathParser contains methods for solving simple operations involving arithmetic operators and functions. These methods can be accessed by subclasses of MathParser.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Version:
    0.1.0, 16/10/2016
    Author:
    Satvik Saha

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MathParser()

      Calculates the factorial of a number.

      Checks whether the String passed to it can be parsed as a number.
      protected static double solveBinaryOperation(double a, java.lang.String op, double b)
      Solves and returns the result of a simple binary expression.
      protected static double solveUnaryFunction(java.lang.String func, double x)
      Solves and returns the result of an expression involving a function with only one operand.

        protected static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String str)
        Checks whether the String passed to it can be parsed as a number.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the String can be parsed as a number

        Calculates the factorial of a number.
        Parameters:
        x - the number whose factorial is to be calculated
        Returns:
        the factorial of the number passed
        Since:

      • solveBinaryOperation

        protected static double solveBinaryOperation(double a,
                                             java.lang.String op,
                                             double b)
        Solves and returns the result of a simple binary expression. Only the following operators are supported : 
        
 	^	-	power
	/	-	division
	*	-	multiplication
	+	-	addition
	-	-	subtraction
        Parameters:
        a - the operand on the left
        op - the opearator
        b - the operand on the right
        Returns:
        the result on evaluating the expression
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • solveUnaryFunction

        protected static double solveUnaryFunction(java.lang.String func,
                                           double x)
                                    throws FunctionNotFoundException
        Solves and returns the result of an expression involving a function with only one operand. Only the following function names are supported : 
        
 	abs	-	absolute value
	fct	-	factorial
	exp	-	exponentiation
	log	-	logarithm (base 'e')
	rad	-	convert degrees to radians
	deg	-	convert radians to degrees
	sin	\
	 *	cos 	|
	tan	 \	standard trigonometric
	sec	 /	functions
	csc	|
	ctn	/
        Parameters:
        func - the function name
        x - the operand
        Returns:
        the result on evaluating the expression
        Throws:
        FunctionNotFoundException - thrown when func is not recognized
        Since:
        0.1.0
